abstract: The pay cuts for the top 25 earners at the two banks could be skewed because their chief executives had already agreed to enormous reductions.
snippet: The pay cuts for the top 25 earners at the two banks could be skewed because their chief executives had already agreed to enormous reductions.
lead_paragraph: In the whirl of the financial crisis, Bank of America and Citigroup stood out for being among the most troubled banks in the industry. Now, they will stand apart.

headline.main: A New Challenge for 2 Ailing Banks
headline.print_headline: A New Challenge for 2 Ailing Banks

abstract: The Obama administration’s plans to slash pay at Bank of America and Citigroup will force them to operate under different rules from the rest of Wall Street.
snippet: The Obama administration’s plans to slash pay at Bank of America and Citigroup will force them to operate under different rules from the rest of Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: In the whirl of the financial crisis, Bank of America and Citigroup stood out for being among the most troubled banks in the industry. Now, they will stand apart, TheNew York Times’s Eric Dash wrote.

headline.main: A New Challenge for 2 Ailing Banks
